Hi
  Lasse  
   Thanks for u r reply
   I download that from junit.org site.
   I down load that as a zip format.it  name is  JSP_Harness.zip. I simple extract that zip and placed that war file in my tomcat 5.5 webserver.That zip file also contain 
  helpfile, In that it descirbe how to set serverconfigurarion and how to set  our test classes in that war file . I followed these instruction step by step, but while      seting  the serverconfiguration, it did't detect my junit.jar and cos.jar file . I put these two jar files in tomcat's  server\lib directory. and also i give severconfigurationi's library path like this     server\lib .
   It give error like this cos.jar, test.jar files are not found 

       Thanks
        nagendrakumar





  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Lasse Koskela 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, March 08, 2007 4:23 PM
  Subject: Re: [junit] web interface to run junit testing


  On 07 Mar 2007 15:46:43 -0800, nagendra_kumar96
  <nagendra.pilla@...> wrote:
  > i would like to perform a junittesting using a webinterface. please
  > suggest to me webinterfaces to perform junittesting
  > at present i am using JSP_Harness ,but in this webinterface
  > ,it give error in server configuration
  > plese give some suggestion to some more webinterfaces to
  > perform junit testing

  A Google search for "JSP_Harness" returns zero hits... Would you care
  to explain what this mysterious JSP_Harness is?

  Lasse
